prompt: <description>Part 1: Construction of a 3D Model of a Rectangular Prism with a Triangular Cutout Creating the Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.3, 0.0] Sketching the 2D Profile Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system and follow these steps: 1. Draw the first line segment (line\\_1) starting from the point [0.0, 0.0] and ending at the point [0.75, 0.0]. 2. Draw the second line segment (line\\_2) starting from the point [0.75, 0.0] and ending at the point [0.75, 0.15]. 3. Draw the third line segment (line\\_3) starting from the point [0.75, 0.15] and ending at the point [0.15, 0.15]. 4. Draw the fourth line segment (line\\_4) starting from the point [0.15, 0.15] and ending at the point [0.0, 0.15]. 5. Draw the fifth line segment (line\\_5) starting from the point [0.0, 0.15] and ending at the point [0.0, 0.0]. Transforming the Sketch into 3D 1. Apply the scaling factor of 0.75 (sketch\\_scale) to the entire sketch. 2. Apply transformation using the given euler angles and the translation vector from the coordinate system. Extruding the Sketch to Create the 3D Model 1. Extrude the 2D profile to a depth of 0.3 towards the normal direction (extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal). 2. Extrude the profile oppositely to the normal direction with no depth (extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal). Part 2: Construction of the Second Half of the Rectangular Prism Creating the Coordinate System Repeat Step 1 to create a new coordinate system with the same parameters as Part 1 to maintain consistency in positioning. Sketching the 2D Profile Repeat Step 2 to create an identical 2D profile. Transforming the Sketch into 3D Repeat Step 3 to transform the second 2D sketch with the scaling and transformation properties of the coordinate system. Extruding the Sketch to Create the 3D Model 1. Extrude the second 2D profile to a depth of 0.3 towards the normal direction. 2. Combine both extruded shapes using a JoinFeatureOperation (operation). Note: Since both sketches are identical, you can duplicate the sketch objects from Part 1 before proceeding with Step 9 to improve efficiency. After the initialization of both parts, the new CAD model will have a slightly tapered top final shape, a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a height of 0.75 (including the 0.3 tapered section from part\\_1 and part\\_2 each), a width of 0.3, and a length of 0.75.</description>
